text: Here i want to talk about the R.A.R movement (rock against racism). It's an artistic and musical movement that took places in the 70's in Paris. This movement was an answer to the multiplication of racists behaviours in big cities where the governement became a lot more violent against black and indian people that were for most of them in the Suburb at this time. A lot of different styles of music assemble to create the movement. We can think of rock obviously but also punk, raggae, ska etc... A lot of famous band played for different festivals organized by R.A.R like the Sex Pistols. It's something that we can notice in there lyrics. If we take for exemple there song "god saves the queen" that is a also the name of the national amthem, they criticize the decision that took the governement at this time but they don't forget to make a call for all the different populations that lived in Paris, even white people to help those populations that were discriminated. They say "white riot, I want a riot, white riot, a riot of my own". A riot of the white population to help the others in there fight against racism. This movement gaves us an important heritage by taking roots in the musical culture that we still listening today. It's important to remember movements like that because they had a role for the emancipation of population during the 20 century, they had the courage to fight and to go against the political movement of their time.
